availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Allen Huston Sympson (Clark County, Kentucky, student, private (U.S.A.), and deputy sheriff. )

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, student and deputy sheriff. Kentucky native. Son of William Chilton Sympson and Mary Ann Sympson. Resident of Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Clark County. Student in Clark County in 1860. Household owned fifteen enslaved persons in Clark County. Served in General Crittenden's Staff as private from 1862 to 1863. Deputy sheriff in Clark County in 1864.

ab.bibl:

Eleventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1890), Veterans' Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, Winchester, p. 7-741.
